inclusion.label: met
inclusion.evidence: Interest in participating in a novel nutritional supplement program

inclusion.label: not_met
inclusion.evidence: Willingness to follow recommendations, including going off of all vitamin-D and calcium containing supplements, multivitamins, or OTC medications (e.g., Tums)

inclusion.label: met
inclusion.evidence: Scoring 0-2 errors on the Short Portable Mental Status Questionnaire

exclusion.label: unknown
exclusion.evidence: Currently enrolled in another research trial for vitamin D dietary supplements or other bone disease treatments

exclusion.label: unknown
exclusion.evidence: Women who are pregnant, during their period, or less than 2 days before or after their period at the time of the assessment

exclusion.label: triggers
exclusion.evidence: Psychiatric diagnosis of schizophrenia, other psychotic disorders, bipolar disorder, major depression with psychotic features, delirium, and alcohol or substance abuse/dependence

exclusion.label: triggers
exclusion.evidence: Gastrointestinal disorders that could lead to uncertain resorption of the study supplements

exclusion.label: triggers
exclusion.evidence: Major conditions such as neurologic, cardiovascular, pulmonary, renal, endocrine, thyroid, hepatic, autoimmune, or bone/joint that could interfere with vitamin D metabolism, psychometric tests, or body composition assessment (especially renal and heart failure)

exclusion.label: triggers
exclusion.evidence: Erratic, accelerated, or mechanically-controlled irregular heart rhythms, atrial fibrillation/flutter, or atrioventricular block or implanted electronic device

notes: The patient has Paget's Disease of Bone and is starting Bisphosphonate therapy. He has a family history of hypertension and DM type 2.
